page.title: 11GELSTON CASTLE - 1930'S
page.content: Fifty years ago there was no electricity supply, but gas was made at the castle. Electricity was introduced in 1938,and took three months to install. The staff consisted of a cook and a kitchenmaid,two upstairs maids,a tablemaid and sometimes a butler. The staff were up at 6a.m.The kitchenmaid had to prepare the kitchen range for breakfast,which was at 9a.m. Other meal times were-lunch at 1p.m. afternoon tea at 4p.m.and dinner at 8p.m. The castle had ten bedrooms,a large drawing-room,a smaller one known as the blue drawing-room,a dining-room and a well-stocked library. The castle had four storeys,and food was sent up to the dining-room in a hand-operated lift.Butter and milk were supplied by Gelston Mill.
